thread.title: Arkansas Red team takes 2-0 lead in Fall World Series
thread.title_full: Arkansas Red team takes 2-0 lead in Fall World Series

title: Arkansas Red team takes 2-0 lead in Fall World Series
text:
Arkansas Red team takes 2-0 lead in Fall World Series - KATV - Breaking News, Weather and Razorback Sports Member Center: Arkansas Red team takes 2-0 lead in Fall World Series Posted: Updated: 
FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) - Arkansas first baseman Cullen Gassaway hit a two-out, 3-run home run in the top of the ninth inning to help the Razorbacks' Red team to a 7-6 win and a 2-games-to-none lead in Arkansas' Fall World Series. 
Gassaway and Austin Catron were both 3-for-4 in Wednesday's game while Barrett Loseke threw two scoreless innings of relief for the win and Hunter Hart earned the save, despite giving up a run and allowing the potential tying run to reach third base. 
Rick Nomura and Chad Spanberger each had home runs for the White team, which led 5-4 going into the ninth. 
The best-of-five series continues Saturday with a game at 11 a.m. Games four and five, if necessary, will be Sunday and Tuesday.
